intro: Conyza solidaginoides, commonly known as yellow ironweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stem and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in open areas such as prairies and roadsides, thriving in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in late summer to early fall. Conyza solidaginoides is also known for its ability to spread through wind-dispersed seeds, contributing to its widespread distribution.
